text.p: Port conditions from Lloyds Shipping Intelligence Service --
AUSTRALIA, April 21 - COAL - QUEENSLAND - Abbot Point - Berth vacant, 3 vessels due by 10/5, no delays.
Hay Point - Two vessels loading, 4 waiting, 10 due by 13/5, no delays.
Dalrymple Bay - Two vessels loading, 4 waiting, 13 due by 30/4, 1-2 days delay expected.

Gladstone - R.G. Tanna - Coal terminal closed for loading during public holidays 23.00 hrs. 24/4 to 23.00 hrs. 25/4 and 23.00 hrs. 4/5 to 23.00 hrs. 5/5. Two vessels loading, 2 waiting, 23 vessels due by 15/5, no delays.
Barney Point - Shiploading maintained during holidays if required. Berth vacant, 3 vessels due by 2/5, no delays.
Brisbane - Five vessels due 10/5, no delays.
NEW SOUTH WALES - Newcastle - Kooragang - 2 Vessels loading, 2 waiting, 15 due by 1/5, 2 days delay expected.
Dykes 4+5 - 2 Vessels loading, 6 waiting, 15 due by 4/5, 10 days delay expected.
Port Kembla - One vessel loading, 23 due by 1/7, no delays expected.

IRON ORE - WESTERN AUSTRALIA - Port Hedland - Mt. Newman (Nelson Point) - Shippers advise that, due to shortage of Mt. Newman and Yandi fines, vessels may experience some berthing/loading delays or be forced to berth out of turn. Due to the current heavy demand for lump ore, vessels may also experience some delays or slower loading rates. Only one vessel can be loaded with lump cargo at a time. A berth - 1 Vessel loading, 1 anchored, 7 due by 1/5. B berth - 1 Vessel loading, 1 anchored, 9 due by 30/4. 8 Other vessels due by 5/5, no eta receed.
Goldsworthy (Finucane island) - Some berthing/loading delays may occur due to shortage of fines and maintenance difficulties. One vessel loading, 1 anchored, 2 others due by 5/5, no eta received.
Dampier - Parker Point - 1 Vessel loading, 3 anchored.
East Intercourse island - 1 Vessel loading, 4 anchored.

Dampier line-up - 20 Vessels due by 8/5 of which 15 for Parker Point, 5 for East Intercourse island. A four-day maintenance shut-down is planned for East Intercourse island from 27/4. Parker Point will be shut down for 24 hour maintenance from 11.00 hrs. 22/4.
Port Walcott - One vessel loading, 1 berthed, 1 anchored, 8 due by 2/5.

GRAIN - QUEENSLAND - Mackay - No vessels due. Shippers expect 3-4 shipments of sorghum totalling c.a. 90,000 mt. Wheat shipments are expected to total between 200,000 mt and 400,000 mt. Shipments are not expected to commence until the end of June at the earliest.
Gladstone - One vessel due 26/4 to load sorghum. Port closed 25/4 (Anzac day).
Brisbane - One vessel loading wheat, 2 waiting of which 1 to load wheat, 1 sorghum. 1 Vessel due 5/5 to load sorghum/wheat. On 25/4, Pinkenba and possibly Fish island terminal are working.
NEW SOUTH WALES - Newcastle - Two vessels loading wheat, 1 waiting to load wheat, 1 due 1/5 to load wheat. Delays on some vessels due to cargo receivals not being completed. No work 25/4.
Sydney - No further grain loading at this port.
Port Kembla - One vessel loading wheat, 16 due by May of which 14 to load wheat, 2 canola. No loading 25/4, but cargo receivals will work normally.
VICTORIA - Geelong - One vessel loading wheat, 2 waiting of which 1 to load wheat, 1 peas. 3 Vessels due by 30/4, all to load wheat. On 25/4 day shift only available if required.
Portland - One vessel loading barley, 8 due by 16/5 of which 2 to load wheat, 1 barley, 5 peas. On 25/4, Vicgrain working at overtime rates.
SOUTH AUSTRALIA - Port Pirie, Thevenard, Ardrossan - No vessels due. On 25/4 volunteer labour only.
Port Adelaide - One vessel loading wheat, 1 waiting to load wheat. On 25/4 volunteer labour only.
Port Lincoln - One vessel loading wheat/barley, 2 due by 27/4 of which 1 to load wheat, 1 lupins. On 25/4 volunteer labour only.
Wallaroo - One vessel due 4/5 to load barley. On 25/4 volunteer labour only.
Port Giles - One vessel due 8/5 to load barley. On 25,4 volunteer labour only.
WESTERN AUSTRALIA - Geraldton - One vessel loading wheat, 3 waiting to load of which 2 wheat, 1 lupins. 7 Vessels due by 4/5 of which 6 to load wheat, 1 lupins. On 25/4, port closed, no work.
Kwinana - Two vessels loading wheat, 3 waiting to load of which 2 wheat, 1 barley. 13 Vessels due by 9/5 of which 11 to load wheat, 2 lupins. On 25/4, port closed, no work.
Albany - One vessel loading canola, 1 vessel due 26/4 to load wheat. On 25/4, port closed, no work.
Esperance - Two vessels due by 28/4 of which 1 to load peas, 1 lupins. On 25/4, port closed, no work.
